comment._content:
MASS FOR SPANISH WAR DEAD
Wilson Called Patriot For Efforts To Insure Peace
Date:May 18, 1914
Fifteen thousand persons attended the annual field mass celebrated here today under the auspices of the District of Columbia Spanish-American War Veterans. When' the Rev. Father J. R. Meagher, who delivered the sermon, referred to President Wilson as a "patriot whose name should not be second to the ...
